concise_definition: v. 取消, 废除, 抵消

definitions.explanation_en: To officially terminate or annul an arrangement, appointment, event, or plan before it takes place, often due to changed circumstances or lack of necessity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某项安排、预约、活动或计划实施前，因情况变化或不再必要而正式终止或废除。
definitions.example_en: The concert was cancelled due to the storm.
definitions.example_cn: 由于暴风雨，音乐会被取消了。

definitions.explanation_en: To counteract or neutralize the effect of something, so that it has no net impact.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指抵消或中和某事物的影响，使其整体效果为零或无效。
definitions.example_en: The bonus he received was cancelled out by the new tax deduction.
definitions.example_cn: 他收到的奖金被新的税收减免抵消了。

definitions.explanation_en: To delete or remove something that has been written, typed, or recorded, often by drawing a line through it or using an undo function.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过划掉、删除或使用撤销功能来移除已书写、打字或记录的内容。
definitions.example_en: She was cancelling out the errors in her draft with a red pen.
definitions.example_cn: 她用红笔划掉了草稿中的错误。

comparison.analysis: “Abort” (中止) 通常指在过程中途强行、紧急或不完全地停止，常带有负面或失败的含义，多用于技术、医疗或军事语境（如中止任务、流产）。而 “cancel” 更中性，强调计划性终止，不必然暗示失败或紧急。
“Terminate” (终止) 更正式、更彻底，常用于合同、雇佣关系或系统运行的结束，强调永久性终结。而 “cancel” 更常用于临时性安排（如会议、预订），有时可被重新安排，不一定是永久性的。
“Offset” (抵消) 与 “cancel” 在‘抵消影响’的语义上有重叠，但 “offset” 更强调用正面因素平衡负面因素（如植树抵消碳排放），而 “cancel” 更强调直接消除或使无效，不必然涉及补偿机制。
